title: Removing Price Scale from Price Structure deletes micro prices
custom_preconds: GIVEN a PV user views the Price Scale tab within a specific price structure
custom_steps: WHEN the user invokes the "remove" action on the right sight of the grid for a price scale config
custom_expected:
THEN a warning displays advising the user that 'Removal of price scale config also removes the pricing if present for those price scales belonging to this config.  Do you wish to continue?"
AND options to CANCEL or OK (i.e. Continue) are actionable.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN they select the CANCEL option
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the warning disappears and no changes occur

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN they select the OK option
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the warning disappears
AND a red lines strikes through the selected price scale config

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects APPLY CHANGES
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN all price points - both macro and micro - defined for the price scales belonging to the selected price scale configuration are deleted/removed from the price structure
AND a 'successful' message displays

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN use add new price scale
AND
Add new Macro price points
AND
Add new micros price points
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN
User can see only newly added macro prices
AND
Newly added micro prices

title: Attempt to remove buyer type from price structure
custom_preconds:
Given a PV user is on the "Supplier Administration" page
    And clicks on "Find"
    And clicks on "Price Structures"
    And enters "*" into the "criteria" field
    And clicks on "Find"
    And clicks on "TESTQA" that has the micro price points
    And clicks on "Buyer Types"
custom_steps: When the user invokes the "remove" action on the right side of the grid for a buyer type that has associated microprices
custom_expected:
Then a warning displays advising the user that Removing this buyer type will remove all price points, including microprices, from this price structure. Continue?
    And options to CANCEL or OK (i.e. Continue) are actionable.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user selects the CANCEL option
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the warning disappears and no changes occur.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user invokes the "remove" action on the right side of the grid for a buyer type that has associated microprices
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a warning displays advising the user that 'Removing Buyer Type Code(s) (ABC, DEF) will remove all price points including microprices from this price structure'
And options to CANCEL or OK (i.e. Continue) are actionable

custom_steps_separated.content: When they select the OK option
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the warning disappears
    And a red line strikes through the selected buyer type.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user selects APPLY CHANGES
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then all price points - both macro and micro - are deleted/removed from the price structure
And an inline message indicating the price structure was updated is displayed (current behavior).

custom_expected:
Then the API response should include:
      """
      <price_structure code="PS1" desc="A Price Structure" event_id="1111" id="1001" sales_type="SINGLE" timestamp="">
        <pricescale currency="USD" display_order="1" id="1001" 
                    ref_price="100.00" min_ref_price="100.00" max_ref_price="100.00" 
                    all_in_ref_price="120.00" all_in_min_ref_price="120.00" all_in_max_ref_price="120.00">
            <buyer_type currency="USD" defaultable="true" display_order="1" full_price="true" id="1" price="100.00">
               <service_charge_group etc../>
            </buyer_type>
            <buyer_type currency="USD" defaultable="false" display_order="1" full_price="true" id="2" price="95.00"/>
            <buyer_type currency="USD" defaultable="false" display_order="1" full_price="true" id="3" price="90.00"/>
        </pricescale>
        </price_structure>
      """
    And the event.microprice_sales_enabled in the response should be true
